title: How ordinary investors can grab their slice of the burgeoning shadow market for private tech companies
text:
Making money on the stock market is so 2012. That was the year that Facebook went public at just one fifth of its current market capitalisation.

Today, however, promising young companies often exhaust their early growth spurts long before they ever float, and their richest investment opportunities are gobbled up in the shadows by well-connected private market investors – leaving ordinary retail investors out in the cold.

Or are they? Over the last decade, private markets have begun to come out of the shadows, becoming not only more active but more transparent and more liquid.
